summary: This document is an email chain from July 2020 between U.S. Pretrial Services and an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) regarding the intake and upcoming arraignment of defendant Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes details about her charges, legal representation, and housing at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, charged with conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and perjury. She is scheduled for arraignment and a bail hearing.

persons.name: Chris Everdell
persons.context: Listed as one of Ghislaine Maxwell's retained defense attorneys in the case.

persons.name: Mark Cohen
persons.context: Listed as one of Ghislaine Maxwell's retained defense attorneys in the case.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The U.S. District Judge before whom Ghislaine Maxwell's arraignment and bail hearing are scheduled.

connections.description: Chris Everdell is listed as retained defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell.
Mark Cohen is listed as retained defense counsel for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Maxwell's Arraignment and Bail Hearing
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell is scheduled to be arraigned and have a bail hearing before Judge Nathan.

events.title: Maxwell's Arrival in SDNY
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell arrived in the Southern District of New York and was expected to be housed at the MDC.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was indicted on charges including conspiracy to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and perjury.
Maxwell's defense team was retained and included attorneys Chris Everdell and Mark Cohen.
Maxwell was expected to be housed at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) following her arrival in the Southern District of New York.
The U.S. Government filed a motion for detention in her case.
The email chain shows coordination between U.S. Pretrial Services and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding defendant intake procedures.
